3.Study name: Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents & Children (ALSPAC)
3.Measures:
Short Mood & Feelings Questionnaire (13-item) (SMFQ)
Generalised Anxiety Disorder-7 Questionnaire (GAD-7)
Warwick-Edinburgh Mental Wellbeing Scale (WEMWBS)
Bespoke measures of alcohol use, smoking, eating behaviours, and impact of COVID-19 pandemic.
3.Participants: Cohort members (approx 28 years old) and their parents
3.Data access:
Data from the first ALSPAC COVID-19 questionnaire (April-May 2020) is now available. You can read more about this resource in the Wellcome Open Research data note.
The dataset as described in the data note is free to access (bar a small admin fee), but if you require other data, usual data access processes apply. Please email alspac-data@bristol.ac.uk if you would like to find out more.
3.Comments: Wellcome Covid Questionnaire used in this study.
3.Links:
http://www.bristol.ac.uk/alspac/covid-19/
http://www.bristol.ac.uk/alspac/news/2020/researcher-update.html
Data note - https://wellcomeopenresearch.org/articles/5-127/v2

6.Study name: Born in Bradford (BiB)
6.Measures:
Adults
Patient Health Questionnaire (8-item) (PHQ-8)
Generalised Anxiety Disorder Questionnaire (7-item) (GAD-7)
Bespoke measures of alcohol use, smoking, treatment and service use, and loneliness.
Children
Revised Children's Anxiety & Depression Scale (RCAD)
Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ) - Parent Reported
6.Methodology: Mostly online survey or telephone interview, some postal/paper.
6.Data access:
Data from the first wave of COVID data collection will be available from September, then updated quarterly for later waves.
All new data collected will become part of the BiB databank and will be shared under existing policies.
6.Comments: Questionnaire completed by participants in both Born in Bradford (BiB) and Born in Bradford's Better Start (BiBBS) cohorts.

7.Study name: Born in Bradford (BiB)
7.Measures:
Adults
Patient Health Questionnaire (8-item) (PHQ-8)
Generalised Anxiety Disorder Questionnaire (7-item) (GAD-7)
ONS4 Personal Wellbeing Questions
Bespoke measures of alcohol use, smoking, treatment and service use, and loneliness.
Children
Revised Children's Anxiety & Depression Scale (RCAD)
Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ) - Parent Reported
EQ-5D
Bespoke measures of worry, and bullying perpetration.
7.Methodology: Mostly online survey or telephone interview, some postal/paper.
7.Data access:
Data from the first wave of COVID data collection will be available from September, then updated quarterly for later waves.
All new data collected will become part of the BiB databank and will be shared under existing policies.

10.Study name: British Cohort Study (BCS70)
10.Measures:
Alcohol Use Disorder Identification Test (AUDIT)
Generalised Anxiety Disorder Questionnaire (2-item) (GAD-2)
Patient Health Questionnaire (2-item) (PHQ-2)
Malaise Inventory
General Health Questionnaire (12-item) (GHQ-12)
10.Participants: All BCS70 cohort members who have provided an email address
10.Data access:
The data collected through this special survey from participants in CLS’s four studies is now available. Researchers can access data from Waves 1 and 2 from the UK Data Service https://beta.ukdataservice.ac.uk/datacatalogue/studies/study?id=8658
To enable cross cohort comparisons, a combined data set will also be made available for research, allowing the results from the CLS and MRC LHA at UCL cohorts to be analysed together.
10.Comments: Wellcome Covid Questionnaire used in this study.

13.Study name: English Longitudinal Study of Ageing (ELSA)
13.Measures:
Generalised Anxiety Disorder-7 Questionnaire (GAD-7)
Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale (7-item) (CES-D)
ONS4 Personal Wellbeing Questions
CASP Quality of Life Scale (12-item)
Bespoke measures of smoking, alcohol use and loneliness (4-item)
13.Participants:
Cohort members. 

Final response rate of 75% (7,040 completed interviews from a sample of 9,392 study participants), with 83% of the surveys completed online and 17% on the phone.
13.Methodology: Online questionnaire, with an option of a telephone interview for those who are unable to access the survey online.
13.Data access: Data from Wave 1 of the ELSA COVID-19 Substudy is available to download now from the UK Data Service https://beta.ukdataservice.ac.uk/datacatalogue/studies/study?id=8688#!/documentation

14.Study name: English Longitudinal Study of Ageing (ELSA)
14.Measures:
Generalised Anxiety Disorder-7 Questionnaire (GAD-7)
Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale (7-item) (CES-D)
ONS4 Personal Wellbeing Questions
CASP Quality of Life Scale (12-item)
Bespoke measures of smoking, alcohol use and loneliness (4-item)
14.Participants:
Cohort members.

Final response rate of 75% (6,794 completed interviews, with fewer study participants issued to the second wave due to refusals and ineligibility) A total of 83% of the surveys were completed online and 17% on the phone.
14.Methodology: Online questionnaire, with an option of a telephone interview for those who are unable to access the survey online.
14.Data access: Data will be made freely available to researchers as soon as possible from the UK Data Service, alongside the main ELSA dataset.

27.Study name: Twins Early Development Study (TEDS)
27.Measures:
Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test (shortened and adapted) (AUDIT)
Fagerstrom Test for Nicotine Dependence (shortened) (FTND)
Strengths & Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ)
Short Mood & Feelings Questionnaire (SMFQ)
Bespoke measures of generalised anxiety disorder severity, suicidal ideation, smoking and vaping, and cannabis use
27.Methodology: Online questionnaire, which can be completed on a desktop/laptop/mobile device.
27.Data access: Please refer to existing data access policy: http://www.teds.ac.uk/researchers/teds-data-access-policy#exclusive_use. TEDS data are not available for sharing immediately after data collection, but are reserved for a period of exclusive use by the TEDS team.

32.Measures:

Bespoke measures of loneliness and smoking

33.Study name: Understanding Society (UKHLS)
33.Measures:
Core questionnaire
General Health Questionnaire (12-item) (GHQ-12)
Alcohol use
Loneliness
The questionnaire includes core content repeated monthly to track changes through the pandemic, as well as rotating content.
33.Methodology: Online questionnaire. A telephone interview will be offered to respondents who wish to take part but who live in a household where no-one is a regular internet user.
33.Data access: Data for Waves 1-7, which can be downloaded from the UK Data Service, are now available. https://beta.ukdataservice.ac.uk/datacatalogue/studies/study?id=8644#!/details

39.Study name: Cognitive Function & Ageing Study II (CFAS II)
39.Measures:
Generalised Anxiety Disorder Questionnaire (7-item) (GAD-7)
Centre for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale (10-item) (CES-D)
Questions will also be drawn from previous CFAS waves of interviewing to allow for comparisons across time and geographies.
39.Participants: Information will be collected from approximately 450 current CFAS II participants, aged over 77 years with 1> cardiovascular risk factors. In addition a small number of informant interviews will be requested from relatives/carers.
39.Data access: Data is expected to be available in June 2021. Process for access will be the same as for main data.
39.Comments: Adapted from the Canadian Longitudinal Study on Ageing COVID-19 Questionnaire Study.

40.Study name: Cognitive Function & Ageing Study II (CFAS II)
40.Measures:
Generalised Anxiety Disorder Questionnaire (7-item) (GAD-7)
Centre for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale (10-item) (CES-D)
Questions will also be drawn from previous CFAS waves of interviewing to allow for comparisons across time and geographies.
40.Participants: Information will be collected from approximately 450 current CFAS II participants, aged over 77 years with 1> cardiovascular risk factors. In addition a small number of informant interviews will be requested from relatives/carers.
40.Data access: Process for access will be the same as for main data.
40.Comments:
Adapted from the Canadian Longitudinal Study on Ageing COVID-19 Questionnaire Study.
Dates of data collection to be confirmed.

41.Study name: Environmental Risk (E-Risk) Longitudinal Twin Study
41.Measures: Bespoke measures of depression and anxiety symptoms, loneliness and psychological wellbeing.
41.Data access: Existing data sharing policies which allows for access and open sharing of the data will be used. Data is expected to be available in 2022.
41.Comments: Many measures adopted from the CoRonavIruS Health Impact Survey (CRISIS) V0.2 Youth Self-Report Baseline Form: Short Form to facilitate comparison with other studies.

42.Study name: Generation Scotland (GS:SFHS) - CovidLife Survey
42.Measures:
Generalised Anxiety Disorder Questionnaire (7-item) (GAD-7)
Patient Health Questionnaire (9-item) (PHQ-9)
Short Warwick-Edinburgh Mental Wellbeing Scale (SWEMWBS)
Self-rated mental health and wellbeing, past mental illness diagnosis, loneliness, psychological wellbeing, smoking and vaping, alcohol use, personality.
42.Participants:
Generation Scotland participants are invited to complete the CovidLife survey.

The CovidLife survey is also open to any UK residents over 18. Researchers are working with the Scottish Health Research Register (SHARE) and other UK research teams to recruit as widely as possible.
42.Links:
https://www.ed.ac.uk/generation-scotland/for-researchers/covidlife
https://www.ed.ac.uk/covid-19-response/latest-news/survey-of-covid-19-s-impact-on-our-everyday-lives
https://www.ed.ac.uk/generation-scotland/what-have-we-found/latest-news/initial-results-of-covidlife-survey-released

44.Study name: Health and Wellbeing of UK Armed Forces Personnel: A Cohort Study
44.Measures:
Short Form Health Survey (36-item) (SF-36)
General Health Questionnaire (12-item + 1 item about change since pandemic) (GHQ-12)
Warwick-Edinburgh Mental Wellbeing Scale (WEMWBS)
Alcohol Use Disorder Identification Test (10-item) (AUDIT-10)
PTSD Checklist (PCL-5)
Problem Gambling Severity Index (PGSI)
Dimensions of Anger Reactions - Revised (DAR-R)
UCLA Loneliness Scale (4-item)
Suicidal ideation, self harm (CIS-R items)
Help-seeking for mental health problems

45.Data access: Existing data sharing policies will be used.
45.Comments: (CRISIS) V0.2 - The CoRonavIruS Health Impact Survey (CRISIS) V0.2 questions used across most IMAGEN sites.

48.Study name: Mental Health of Children & Young People Surveys
48.Measures:
For young people aged 11-16 years
Strengths & Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ)
Warwick-Edinburgh Mental Wellbeing Scale (WEMWBS)
Pandemic Anxiety Scale (7-item) (PAS)
For young people aged 17-22 years
Strengths & Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ)
General Health Questionnaire (GHQ)
Pandemic Anxiety Scale (7-item) (PAS)
For parents
General Health Questionnaire (GHQ)
Pandemic Anxiety Scale (4-item self report, 5-item report on child) (PAS)
48.Participants: This study uses a repeated cross-sectional design. A new sample of children and young people aged 11-22 years and their parents will be recruited.

51.Study name: Next Steps
51.Measures:
General Health Questionnaire (28-item) (GHQ-28)
Alcohol Use Disorder Identification Test (AUDIT)
Generalised Anxiety Disorder Questionnaire (2-item) (GAD-2)
Patient Health Questionnaire (2-item) (PHQ-2)
Bespoke measures of smoking, life satisfaction and loneliness
51.Participants: All Next Steps cohort members who have provided an email address.
51.Data access:
The data collected through this special survey from participants in CLS’s four studies is now available. Researchers can access data from Waves 1 and 2 from the UK Data Service https://beta.ukdataservice.ac.uk/datacatalogue/studies/study?id=8658
To enable cross cohort comparisons, a combined data set will also be made available for research, allowing the results from the CLS and MRC LHA at UCL cohorts to be analysed together.
51.Comments: Wellcome Covid Questionnaire used in this study.
51.Links:
https://cls.ucl.ac.uk/covid-19-survey/
https://cls.ucl.ac.uk/ucls-longitudinal-studies-to-survey-thousands-about-impact-of-covid-19/
https://cls.ucl.ac.uk/covid-19-data-from-five-national-longitudinal-cohort-studies-now-available/

53.Study name: Next Steps
53.Measures:
General Health Questionnaire (28-item) (GHQ-28)
Alcohol Use Disorder Identification Test (AUDIT)
Generalised Anxiety Disorder Questionnaire (2-item) (GAD-2)
Patient Health Questionnaire (2-item) (PHQ-2)
Bespoke measures of smoking, life satisfaction and loneliness
53.Participants: All Next Steps cohort members who have provided an email address
53.Data access:
The data collected through this special survey from the NSHD and SABRE participants will be made available to researchers though the UK Data Service. For further information see the CLS website. Wave 3 data is expected to be available from early June 2021.
To enable cross cohort comparisons, a combined data set will also be made available for research, allowing the results from the CLS and MRC LHA at UCL cohorts to be analysed together.
53.Comments: Wellcome Covid Questionnaire used in this study.

54.Study name: Resilience, Ethnicity & Adolescent Mental Health (REACH)
54.Measures:
Strengths & Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ)
Generalised Anxiety Disorder Questionnaire (7-item) (GAD-7)
Short Mood & Feelings Questionnaire (SMFQ)
Adolescent Psychotic Symptom Screener (4 selected items - hallucinations, delusions)
Self-harm (2-items from DAWBA, past 4 weeks)
54.Methodology: Online questionnaire + video diary qualitative sub-study.
54.Data access: Existing data sharing policies will be used.

55.Study name: TwinsUK - The UK Adult Twin Registry
55.Measures:
Hospital Anxiety & Depression Scale (HADS)
Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-2)
Generalised Anxiety Disorder Questionnaire (2-item) (GAD-2)
55.Methodology:
Participants could complete the questionnaire online. 

Participants could also be sent a paper questionnaire by mail for them to complete at home. These participants were then called by an interviewer who filled the online questionnaire based on the answers provided.
55.Data access: Data sharing policies will remain the same as for TwinsUK main data.

56.Study name: TwinsUK - The UK Adult Twin Registry
56.Measures:
Hospital Anxiety & Depression Scale (HADS)
Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-2)
Generalised Anxiety Disorder Questionnaire (2-item) (GAD-2)
56.Methodology:
Participants can complete the questionnaire online. 

Participants an also be sent a paper questionnaire by mail for them to complete at home. These participants will then be called by an interviewer who will fill the online questionnaire based on the answers provided.
56.Data access: Data sharing policies will remain the same as for TwinsUK main data.

57.Study name: Growing up in Scotland: Birth Cohort 1 (GUS)
57.Measures:
Composite International Diagnostic Interview - Depression, Short‐Form (CIDI‐SF)
Generalised Anxiety Disorder Questionnaire (7-item) (GAD-7)
Strengths & Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ)
57.Participants: Sub-sample of Growing up in Scotland participants (approximately 20% of the cohort)
57.Data access: Data is expected to be deposited with the UK Data Service (UKDS) in 2021.

58.Study name: Wirral Child Health & Development Study (WCHADS)
58.Measures:
Cohort member (self-report)
Mood & Feelings Questionnaire – Short Version (SMFQ)
Borderline Personality Disorder Features Scale (BPD-FS)
Child Trauma Scale - reactions subscale
Spence Anxiety Scale – Short Version
Olweus Bully/Victim Questionnaire – cyber-bullying only
Repetitive Negative Thinking Questionnaire (general and COVID-focused rumination)
COVID-19 related worry
Cohort member (mother report)
Child Behaviour Checklist (CBCL)
Borderline Personality Disorder Features Scale (BPD-FS)
Mood & Feelings Questionnaire – Short Version (SMFQ)
Child Trauma Scale – reactions subscale
Spence Anxiety Scale – Short Version
Inventory of Callous-Unemotional Traits (ICU)
Nisonger Child Behaviour Rating Scale - self-harm subscale
Baillargeon Peer Aggression Scale
Treatment and service use
School exclusion
Mother (self-report)
Patient Health Questionnaire (9-item) (PHQ-9)
GAD-7 Anxiety Questionnaire
COVID-19 related worry
UCL
Smoking, alcohol use, substance use
Treatment and service use
Cohort member’s siblings (mother report)
Child Behaviour Checklist (CBCL)
58.Participants: Cohort members, their mothers and siblings.
58.Data access: Existing data sharing policies will be used. Data is expected to be available in approximately early 2021.
